    A collection of utilities for working with lists.

    • Method Detail

      • getInsertionEndIndex

        public static int getInsertionEndIndex(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
                       java.util.concurrent.Delayed key)
        This function uses the binary search and adds a small amount of logic such that it determines the placement index for a given item. It is designed to always place the item after any existing items that match the key's delay.
        Parameters:
        list - List to search entries for placement
        key - key for searching placement of
        Returns:
        the index to insert the key into the list

      • getInsertionEndIndex

        public static int getInsertionEndIndex(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
                       java.util.concurrent.Delayed key,
                       boolean randomAccessList)
        This function uses the binary search and adds a small amount of logic such that it determines the placement index for a given item. It is designed to always place the item after any existing items that match the key's delay.
        Parameters:
        list - List to search entries for placement
        key - key for searching placement of
        randomAccessList - boolean for optimization with binary search
        Returns:
        the index to insert the key into the list

      • getInsertionEndIndex

        public static int getInsertionEndIndex(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
                       long insertionValueInMillis,
                       boolean randomAccessList)
        This function uses the binary search and adds a small amount of logic such that it determines the placement index for a given item. It is designed to always place the item after any existing items that match the key's delay.
        Parameters:
        list - List to search entries for placement
        insertionValueInMillis - delay time in milliseconds to search for insertion point
        randomAccessList - boolean for optimization with binary search
        Returns:
        the index to insert the key into the list

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
               java.util.concurrent.Delayed key)
        A faster binary search algorithm for sorting a list. This algorithm works by actually knowing the values and making smart decisions about how far to jump in the list based on those values. Which is why this can not take in a comparable interface like Collections does. This was adapted from code posted from this blog post: http://ochafik.com/blog/?p=106
        Parameters:
        list - to be searched through
        key - delay value to search for
        Returns:
        index where found, or -(insertion point) - 1 if not found

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
               java.util.concurrent.Delayed key,
               boolean randomAccessList)
        A faster binary search algorithm for sorting a list. This algorithm works by actually knowing the values and making smart decisions about how far to jump in the list based on those values. Which is why this can not take in a comparable interface like Collections does. This was adapted from code posted from this blog post: http://ochafik.com/blog/?p=106
        Parameters:
        list - to be searched through
        key - delay value to search for
        randomAccessList - true to optimize for list that have cheap random access
        Returns:
        index where found, or -(insertion point) - 1 if not found

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(java.util.List<? extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed> list,
               long insertionValueInMillis,
               boolean randomAccessList)
        A faster binary search algorithm for sorting a list. This algorithm works by actually knowing the values and making smart decisions about how far to jump in the list based on those values. Which is why this can not take in a comparable interface like Collections does. This was adapted from code posted from this blog post: http://ochafik.com/blog/?p=106
        Parameters:
        list - to be searched through
        insertionValueInMillis - delay time in milliseconds to search for insertion point
        randomAccessList - true to optimize for list that have cheap random access
        Returns:
        index where found, or -(insertion point) - 1 if not found
